definition: to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: It was a stupid their lender, according to Mr.
sentences.chinese: 按照彭伯頓的說法，貸款人短視而愚蠢。

sentences.english: But their lender said they were a bad credit risk.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們的貸款人表示，他們的信用風險不好。

sentences.english: Lenders and mortgage brokers tend to lighten up qualifications during the winter months.
sentences.chinese: 貸款人和抵押貸款經紀人往往減倉在冬季資格。

sentences.english: It shows the climate change agenda remains very important for international leaders.
sentences.chinese: 它表明，氣候變化議程對國際貸款人來說仍然很重要。

sentences.english: It was a stupid their lender, according to Mr. Pemberton.
sentences.chinese: 按照彭伯頓的說法，貸款人短視而愚蠢。

sentences.english: With the consent of the lender, the borrowers may repay the principal and interest of the loans ahead of schedule.
sentences.chinese: 經貸款人同意，借款人可提前歸還貸款本息。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
to claim a credit against/tax reduction
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
Huinong district of Shizuishan city 石嘴山市[Shi2 zui3 shan1 shi4], Ningxia
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
